xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9" xmlns="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-image/1.1" xmlns:video="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-video/1.1">
https://tmrev.io/movie/443295-Bowie2001- A Space Oddity 2022-11-27
https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/kKgei6pEHMSEjgJpuzBsnZhoy0V.jpg In 2011, Manchester DJ Fritz von Runte undertook a project that would fuse the music of David Bowie with the cinema of Stanley Kubrick. Using Bowie’s original tracks, he put together a CD and mp3 package called Bowie2001. The music was available as a free download. Also offered was a higher-quality full-length mix and a CD. To accompany the music, a free torrent of a 100-minute film was available. Called Bowie2001 - A Space Oddity, the movie rearranged visuals from Kubrick’s classic 2001 and matched them with von Runte’s Bowie mix. Bowie2001- A Space Oddity
